com.codemelon.graph.graph

Class Graph<T extends Vertex>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codemelon.graph.graph.Graph<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DirectedSimpleGraph

    public abstract class Graph<T extends Vertex>
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Graph()
      Initialize graph to a default initial capacity of 16 vertices
      Graph(java.util.Collection<T> vertices)
      Use the vertices in a collection as the initial vertices in the graph
      Graph(int initialCapacity)
      Initialize graph to have capacity for the given number of vertices

        Parameters:
        initialCapacity - expected number of vertices

      • Graph

        public Graph(java.util.Collection<T> vertices)
        Use the vertices in a collection as the initial vertices in the graph
        Parameters:
        vertices - collection of vertices that will make up the initial vertices of the graph

    • Method Detail

      • addVertex

        public final boolean addVertex(T vertex)
        Inserts vertex if it is not already present.
        Parameters:
        vertex - vertex to be inserted
        Returns:
        true if the graph did not already contained the specified vertex

      • containsVertex

        public final boolean containsVertex(Vertex vertex)
        Shows whether or not the graph contains the given vertex
        Parameters:
        vertex - the vertex whose presence in the graph is to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the vertex is present in the graph

      • removeVertex

        public final boolean removeVertex(Vertex vertex)
        Remove a vertex from the graph. The vertex is removed along with its adjacency list, and it is also removed from the adjacency set of the other vertices in the graph. After this method call, not only will the vertex not belong to the graph, but the adjacency list of the vertex will also be cleared.
        Parameters:
        vertex - vertex to be removed from the graph
        Returns:
        true iff the vertex was found in the graph

      • vertexCount

        public final int vertexCount()
        Number of vertices in the graph
        Returns:
        number of vertices in the graph

      • getVertices

        public final java.util.Set<T> getVertices()
        Returns a set containing the vertices in the graph.
        Returns:
        the set of vertices in the graph

      • vertexIterator

        public final java.util.Iterator<T> vertexIterator()
        Returns an iterator over the vertices in the graph
        Returns:
        iterator over the graph's vertices

      • containsEdge

        public final boolean containsEdge(T from,
                   T to)
        Shows whether or not the graph contains the specified edge
        Parameters:
        from - the tail or source vertex of the edge for which we are testing
        to - the head or target vertex of the edge for which we are testing
        Returns:
        true if the edge from the given tail to the given head exists in the graph.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either vertex is not present in the graph

      • edgeCount

        public abstract int edgeCount()
        Returns the number of edges in the graph. This method is abstract because the implementation will differ in directed and undirected graphs.
        Returns:
        the number of edges in the graph
